Bill Venners wrote:
> If I understand this correctly, the term resource in the 
> REST and HTTP context means a thing of value as perceived 
> by the people using the  system. If all you have is a bunch 
> of URIs, you can't make any assumptions about whether 
> they refer to the same resource or not. But if you have a 
> bunch of URIs plus more semantic information about the 
> resources they represent, then you can make such 
> assumptions.

Yes, that's where my thoughts are headed..

--
-Mike Schinkel
